short_desc._text: Undo of State creation on MSM diagrams fail if state grandparent is a StateMachine.

thetext._text:
Created attachment 280893
StackTrace of the exception after undo.

On MSM diagram, if the user undo a State creation, which container of the container is an AbstractState, an exception occurs : BasicIndexOutOfBoundsException


Scenario to reproduce:

1- Create a Capella project
2- Add a StateMachine on the root LogicalSystem (LogicalArchitecture>Structure>LogicalSystem)
3- Add a State on the region of the previous created StateMachine
4- Create a MSM diagram on the region of the new State
5- Create two states
6- Undo -> an exception occurs

After few analysis, it seems that during undo, list of object to change is first recovered (class ChangeDescriptionImpl.java).
Then for each object to change, we reverse operation on their features (featureChange.applyAndReverse(objectToChange)).
The first object to change is the region on which we remove the state from involvedState (containement=false) and ownedState (containement=true)reference.
The second object to change is the StateMachine on which we remove the state from referencedStates (containement=false) reference but it has already been removed previously, so an exception occurs.
I can reproduce. This is caused by the data notifier reacting blindly to single notifications, regardless of context. Quite hard to fix without changing the DataNotifier itself.

desc._text: StackTrace of the exception after undo.

short_desc._text: DataNotifier should be transactional

thetext._text:
The DataNotifier mechanism in Capella should be transactional. It currently works on a per Notification basis and this causes all sorts of trouble, e.g. 

https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=553857
https://bugs.polarsys.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2692

short_desc._text: Improve the 'Add link for Model Element' dialog in the RichText Component

thetext._text:
The 'Add link for Model Element' could be improved in order to facilitate the insertion of 'Model Element' links.

Here are current issues when using this dialog.

1) When entering a filtering pattern the tree is not automatically expanded and therefore no results are shown. The user needs to click on each tree item in order to navigate to the displayed tree nodes. Depending on the tree depth this can take some time.

2) The tree is refreshed on each 'key pressed event', for big models this causes performance issues and the dialog can freeze.

3) When pressing 'Enter' no tree element is selected. Instead the dialog is closed with no valid input.

The purpose of this ticket is to fix all of these issues.

OpenSSH 7.8 changed the private key format from PEM to their own OpenSSH format (https://www.openssh.com/txt/release-7.8) and it seems to have broken JSch used by JGit. I reported it as https://sourceforge.net/p/jsch/bugs/129/.

There's a workaround posted on Stackoverflow - https://stackoverflow.com/a/55740276/3827

I am sorry since I do not know 3p, but should this ticket not be assigned to Remote System Explorer (which is a component of the Target Management product)?

And could it have a clearer name ("Connection via PEM public key fails vaguely", or "Connection via PEM public key unsupported")?

> OpenSSH 7.8 changed the private key format from PEM to their own OpenSSH
> format (https://www.openssh.com/txt/release-7.8) and it seems to have broken
> JSch used by JGit. I reported it as https://sourceforge.net/p/jsch/bugs/129/.
> 
> There's a workaround posted on Stackoverflow -
> https://stackoverflow.com/a/55740276/3827

Thank you very much for both forwarding this and pointing to the workaround. I confirm the PuTTYgen version of the workaround.

short_desc._text: Better manage default preference initialization

thetext._text:
The aim of this ticket is to initialize, for Capella product, the sirius default preferences with a config.ini associated to the product

Currently it is done in org.polarsys.capella.common.platform.sirius.customisation.SiriusCustomizationPlugin
But the way it is done may be improved because currently we are forced to reapply command line preference because it has already be done when the org.eclipse.sirius plugin (owning the preference and their initialization) has been loaded.

short_desc._text: Installed listeners on RichText are lost, after editing elements from 2 different projects

thetext._text:
Installed listeners on RichText are lost, after editing elements from 2 different projects.

Reproduction scenario:

1 Create a project A and add a hyperlink towards an element/diagram
2 Double click the link => Navigation towards referenced element OK
3 Create a project B and add a hyperlink towards an element/diagram
4 Double click the link => Navigation towards referenced element KO, an edit link element dialog is presented instead
5 Go back to project A and double click the link => Navigation towards referenced element KO, an edit link element dialog is presented instead

The open link functionality is lost but also all the installed listeners features, here is a complete list:
# Confirmation dialog when pasting formatted elements from word (tables and such)
# Listener that overrides the default double click event of CKEDITOR to open links.
# Listener that saves the editor content when receiving a focus out event.
# Listeners that resets the dirty state when receiving a 'focus' event.
https://github.com/eclipse/kitalpha/pull/6

short_desc._text: Refresh All Sub Representations needs progress monitoring improvements.

thetext._text:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #554447 +++

Steps to reproduce with Capella 1.3.1: 
* Open a Capella project with a large amount of representations
* Select the .aird and launch the Refresh All Sub Representations
* A dialog is displayed asking for confirmation. It shows the number of found representations
* Clic on ok.
* Clic on the progress icon or open the Progress view
* The task is renamed for each refreshed representations the progress bar shows one tick sometimes before being set to 0.
* Users do not known when this will end or the amount of done/remaining work. 

I detected the issue on a project with 328 representations.

Additional remark: It seems that the action should be called refresh all representations, I do not see the meaning of "Sub" in this case.

Status: resolved
Resolution: fixed

Status: verified
Resolution: fixed

I tried to reproduce this bug with the cybersecurity viewpoint, but to no avail. It seems exclusive to the basic mass, price and perfo viewpoints.

Created attachment 282316
The Library and the Project showing the bug

Step to reproduce:

3 - Lauch transition LA to PA of these function : nothing happens

problem reproduced with version : 1.3.1, 1.4.0 and capella-1.4.1.202003251617

Bug is due to a Library created without Operational Analysis.

short_desc._text: Git index cannot be used by diff/merge tool

thetext._text:
Comparing working dir models with index or index with HEAD fails with a NPE.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.emf.diffmerge.connector.git.ext.GitHelper.isConflicting(GitHelper.java:184)
	at org.eclipse.emf.diffmerge.connector.git.ext.GitHelper.isConflicting(GitHelper.java:167)
	at org.eclipse.emf.diffmerge.connector.git.ext.GitHelper.isConflicting(GitHelper.java:152)
	at org.eclipse.emf.diffmerge.connector.git.ext.GitIndexRevisionScopeDefinitionFactory.getURIForRevision(GitIndexRevisionScopeDefinitionFactory.java:112)
	at org.eclipse.emf.diffmerge.connector.core.ext.AbstractRevisionScopeDefinitionFactory.convertToURI(AbstractRevisionScopeDefinitionFactory.java:56)
	at org.eclipse.emf.diffmerge.connector.core.ext.AbstractURIConvertingScopeDefinitionFactory.createScopeDefinition(AbstractURIConvertingScopeDefinitionFactory.java:49)
	at org.eclipse.emf.diffmerge.ui.setup.ComparisonSetupManager.createComparisonSetup(ComparisonSetupManager.java:169)
	at org.eclipse.emf.diffmerge.connector.core.ext.TeamComparisonViewer.createSetup(TeamComparisonViewer.java:229)
	at org.eclipse.emf.diffmerge.connector.core.ext.TeamComparisonViewer.createEditorInput(TeamComparisonViewer.java:194)
	at org.eclipse.emf.diffmerge.connector.core.ext.TeamComparisonViewer.handleCompareInput(TeamComparisonViewer.java:304)
	at org.eclipse.emf.diffmerge.connector.core.ext.TeamComparisonViewer.setInput(TeamComparisonViewer.java:518)
	at org.eclipse.compare.CompareViewerSwitchingPane.setInput(CompareViewerSwitchingPane.java:268)

Well well...
I could not reproduce with a fresh Capella environment. Since the error appeared in a Capella extended with two viewpoints, although it seems completely unrelated, I moved out one of the viewpoints from the /dropins folder and restarted. To my great surprise, it solved the problem.

It also solved another problem I just spotted, which is that scope resolution in a past commit failed with an EGit message stating the model file could not be found, and a lower-level message stating that protocol 'commit:' was unknown.

Obviously, I then moved the viewpoint folder back into /dropins to check, restarted and... could not reproduce the problem.

To sum up: removing then re-adding a viewpoint at filesystem level solved this issue as well as other ones. Closing this ticket as invalid, given I cannot reproduce the issue any more and assuming my original configuration was flawed. The question remains as to how easily and frequently such flawed configurations can be obtained.

short_desc._text: MARTE release and CDO

thetext._text:
In AMASS we used a non official release of MARTE that contains a patch which allows using MARTE with CDO. However this version of MARTE has some problems with the CHESS profile static re-generation.
So, regarding the target platform of CHESS to be used for the next release 1.0.0, I propose to use the official MARTE release.

This implies:

1) the CHESS CDO support (org.polarsys.chess.cdo) will not be usable; however I think ths is not a problem given that we experimented major bugs while using Papyrus-CDO in Neon...
2)models done with previous CHESS installation, for instance the one available with OpenCert, could require the resolution of some MARTE stereotypes applied in the model; this resolution is supported by Papyrus, as automatic feature, but could also require some manual editing.

URI to be replaced in the CHESS model:

Non official MARTE --> Official MARTE (1.2.0)

http://www.eclipse.org/papyrus/MARTE/1#//MARTE_DesignModel/ --> http://www.eclipse.org/papyrus/MARTE/1#//

http://www.eclipse.org/papyrus/MARTE/1#//MARTE_Foundations/ --> http://www.eclipse.org/papyrus/MARTE/1#//

http://www.eclipse.org/papyrus/MARTE/1#//MARTE_AnalysisModel/ --> http://www.eclipse.org/papyrus/MARTE/1#//

http://www.eclipse.org/papyrus/MARTE/1#//MARTE_Annexes/VSL/DataTypes --> http://www.eclipse.org/papyrus/MARTE/1#//VSL/DataTypes
Updated QVTo Transformations for schedulability analysis (using MARTE) as well

short_desc._text: Memory leaks with CommonActionProvider on contextual menu

thetext._text:
Created attachment 282947
memoryLeaksWithCommonActionProvider.png

The actions provided by extension point "org.eclipse.ui.navigator.navigatorContent" can cause memory leaks.
For example, when the contextual menu is open on a semantic element, the "context" of "org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.navigator.actions.providers.EditCommonActionProvider" is set with the semantic element. This context is changed on the next click on a "compatible object". For EditCommonActionProvider, only EObjects are compatible. If you close the session, the "EditCommonActionProvider" retains the semantic element and with it all the semantic model.

Steps to reproduce:
* Launch Capella with Yourkit (in a workspace containing the IFE project)
* Check that "Link with Editor" is disabled
* Open the session (using contextual menu "Open Session" on the aird file)
* Open the contextual menu on "Operational Analysis" node, and expand the menu "Add Capella Element"
* Click 2 times on escape key (to close the menu)
* Close the session (using contextual menu "Close" on the aird file)
* Launch a garbage collector
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit
* In "Object explorer" view of YourKit, filter on org.polarsys.capella.core.data.oa.impl.OperationalAnalysisImpl.
* There is one instance of this kind. Select it and click on "Calculate paths" int the "Paths from GC Roots"
* It is retained by several paths but at least:
** "org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.navigator.actions.providers.EditCommonActionProvider"
** "org.polarsys.capella.core.menu.dynamic.DynamicActionProvider"

memoryLeaksWithCommonActionProvider.png shows the observed leaks.

Remark 1: The size of the leak depends of the size of the semantic model (all elements of the semantic model are indirectly be retained).

Remark 2: This leak is "temporary". If you open another session, and click on another semantic element, it will replace the previous in the context of CommonActionProviders.

A solution will be to add all the CommonActionProviders provided by Capella as SessionListener to listen "org.eclipse.sirius.business.api.session.SessionListener.CLOSING" and to clean the context if it concerns an EObject of the session.

short_desc._text: Memory leaks with FullDecoratorRunnable

thetext._text:
Created attachment 282948
memoryLeaksWithFullDecoratorRunnable.png

With the same scenario as bug 563385, we can observe than there are memory leaks retained by FullDecoratorRunnable (org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.FullImageDecoratorRunnable or org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.FullTextDecoratorRunnable).

As you can see in memoryLeaksWithFullDecoratorRunnable.png, the FullImageDecoratorRunnable and the FullTextDecoratorRunnable retain the semantic elements even if the session is closed.

This is maybe linked to bug 167018 (but it has been closed as a duplicate of another bugzilla). In this bug, it was written that "full decorators are lot less effecient". Maybe the org.polarsys.capella.common.re.ui.decorators.InstanciationLabelDecorator should be "lightweight"? I don't really know the differences and I don't master the impacts. It is only a proposal.

short_desc._text: Memory leak with CapellaValidateAction

thetext._text:
Created attachment 282958
memoryLeaksWithCapellaValidateAction.png

"CapellaValidateAction" retains the "TransactionalEditingDomain" (through its field "domain"), even if the corresponding session is closed. Furthermore, it seems that one CapellaValidateAction is created at each display of contextual menu (and retained in the list "org.eclipse.jface.viewers.Viewer.selectionChangedListeners" of the "org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.navigator.view.CapellaCommonViewer".

The domain is set in "org.eclipse.emf.edit.ui.action.ValidateAction.setActiveWorkbenchPart(IWorkbenchPart)".

Steps to reproduce:
* Launch Capella with Yourkit (in a workspace containing 2 Capella projects, I call them "P1" and "P2" in th scenario)
* Check that "Link with Editor" is disabled
* Open the session of project "P1" (using contextual menu "Open Session" on aird file)
* Open the contextual menu on "Operational Analysis" node (expand the root of semantic tree if necessary)
* Click on escape key (to close the menu)
* Open the contextual menu on "Operational Analysis" node
* Click on escape key (to close the menu)
* Open the contextual menu on "Operational Analysis" node
* Click on escape key (to close the menu)
* Open the session of project "P2" (using contextual menu "Open Session" on aird file)
* Open the contextual menu on "Operational Analysis" node (expand the root of semantic tree if necessary)
* Click on escape key (to close the menu)
* Open the contextual menu on "Operational Analysis" node
* Click on escape key (to close the menu)
* Close the session of "P1" (using contextual menu "Close" on the aird file)
* Close the session of "P2" (using contextual menu "Close" on the aird file)
* Launch a garbage collector
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit
* In "Object explorer" view of YourKit, filter on "org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.actions.CapellaValidateAction".
* There are 5 instances of this kind.
** One of them is retained by the "org.polarsys.capella.core.validation.ui.actions.ValidationActionProvider" with "defaultValidationAction" field (the last created)
** All of them are retained in the "selectionChangedListeners" list of "CapellaCommonViewer"
** They retain the TED of both sessions.

You can see in memoryLeaksWithCapellaValidateAction.png the Yourkit resukt corresponding to this scenario.

short_desc._text: On xDFB, titleblock are always recreated while refresh
Request forge-committer permissions

thetext._text:
Dear webmaster,

I’m asking you the possibility to have the forge-committer permissions enabled.

Most contributions to CHESS come from either European or Internal research projects. This implies that the software extension is conceived, created, and managed by the project teams and internally shared on the project repositories. Such code is later integrated in the open-source repository. In this scenario, the possibility to push only my own commits is a strong limitation and forces to squash the team commits losing traceability of the original committer.

You lose me as soon as you say internally shared.

Have your contributors contribute to the public repository.

(In reply to Wayne Beaton from comment #1)
> You lose me as soon as you say internally shared.
> 
> Have your contributors contribute to the public repository.

May I ask you the possibility to have the forge-committer permission temporary? There are commits that are not yet pushed to the CHESS repository. 

Nevertheless, we plan to work directly on the public CHESS repository for our next contributions, whenever possible.

Dear Wayne,

could you please consider the request from Alberto?
The commits to be pushed are required to close some open points we have for the upcoming release of CHESS, planned for the next month.

Thank you.
In particular, the commits to be pushed solve bug 561629, which is part of the release 1.0.0, planned for end of May.

Just to highlight that the forge-commit would be used just as an exception, we already moved to the more principled process: the branch https://git.eclipse.org/c/chess/chess.git/log/?h=562302-Implement-unit-tests-for-existing-features is created in the Ecplise repository to fix the following bug https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=562302.

I would like to support this request from the CHESS committers, that is blocking the next release of CHESS. This would be required just once for old code.
We have manged to changed our process and now we 
have all the contributors contributing to the public repository.

This request will not be repeated in the future

The Eclipse Foundation's manner of open source is such that all work must be done in the public repository. When you work from an "internally shared" repository, it is impossible for anybody outside of your internal team to participate in any meaningful way. When you that you have address this, do you mean that all future contribution activity will occur directly in the repository provided by the Eclipse Foundation (i.e., that all future contribution activity will be open and transparent as required by the Eclipse Development Process?)

Have all contributors signed the ECA?

Per the Eclipse IP Due Diligence Process, since this work was done outside of the supervision of the PMC, it must be reviewed and approved by the the Eclipse IP Team before it can be rolled into the project code. Please open a "project code" CQ with the entire code delta as an attachment. I'll ask the IP Team to fast track their review. With the IP team's approval, I'll approve the webmaster allowing forge-committer permission to push the content in its current form.

short_desc._text: Use of download.polarsys.org

thetext._text:
Dear Webmaster,

In the CHESS website (https://www.eclipse.org/chess/) there are links to the website http://download.polarsys.org/chess/.

Is it still available?
If yes, how can we publish new resources?
If no, can we use the CHESS website repo to upload resources or there are some limitations (in terms of size for example)?

For Papyrus projects, there were the possibility to publish resources using http://download.polarsys.org/.

For Eclispe projects it is possible to use https://download.eclipse.org/.

What is the procedure to use such repository to publish resources?

When the Polarsys forge was merged into Eclipse.org the contents of downloads.polarsys.org were transferred to download.eclipse.org so any existing links should be updated to reflect the change in domain, but they should 'just work' at that point.

For adding new contents there are a couple of options:

1) SFTP/SCP via build.eclipse.org(use your committer credentials to connect)

2) Via a CI instance at ci.eclipse.org

Our recommended solution is number 2(see https://wiki.eclipse.org/Jenkins#How_do_I_deploy_artifacts_to_download.eclipse.org.3F for specifics) as the build.eclipse.org server is scheduled for shutdown in the future. 

If you use option #1 the path you are need to copy the files to is ~/downloads/chess .  There is no 'shell' service available on build, which is why we recommend using a CI instance.

-M.

(In reply to Eclipse Webmaster from comment #2)
> When the Polarsys forge was merged into Eclipse.org the contents of
> downloads.polarsys.org were transferred to download.eclipse.org so any
> existing links should be updated to reflect the change in domain, but they
> should 'just work' at that point.
> 
> For adding new contents there are a couple of options:
> 
> 1) SFTP/SCP via build.eclipse.org(use your committer credentials to connect)
> 
> 2) Via a CI instance at ci.eclipse.org
> 
> Our recommended solution is number 2(see
> https://wiki.eclipse.org/Jenkins#How_do_I_deploy_artifacts_to_download.
> eclipse.org.3F for specifics) as the build.eclipse.org server is scheduled
> for shutdown in the future. 
> 
> If you use option #1 the path you are need to copy the files to is
> ~/downloads/chess .  There is no 'shell' service available on build, which
> is why we recommend using a CI instance.
> 
> -M.

MAny thanks for the answer.

The option 1 worked to me.

The option 2 is not clear to me (I'm not familiar with Jenkins).
"openshift" is shown behind CHESS, so the SSH credentials are set up on the CHESS's Jenkins instance, but I'don't know how to proceed.

(In reply to Alberto Debiasi from comment #3)

> "openshift" is shown behind CHESS, so the SSH credentials are set up on the
> CHESS's Jenkins instance, but I'don't know how to proceed.

The wiki link I provided has an example, but essentially you just create a job that copies the output of your build process to the downloads directory.  That way you have a repeatable deployment that any CHESS committer can use which provides for more flexibility in the project.

If you need specific assistance you can file a bug against the CI(or maybe CBI) components, or talk to the folks on the cbi-dev list.  You may also want to check out the archives for cross-project-issues as I'm pretty sure I've seen people discussing this kind of thing in the past.

-M.

Thanks.
This issue can be closed.

short_desc._text: Obfuscation Documentation Missing

thetext._text: When exporting two capella projects (direct copies of each other) and the single referenced Library to Teams for Capella server, attempting to connect to one model results in an "Unhandled Event Loop Exception" at the final connection dialog.

Corrected the title of the bug as appropriate to the missing Obfuscation Documention from the Capella menu.  Please disregard the original title/comment about Teams For Capella... clerical error on my part.

There is not documentation about how the obfuscation function works in Capella to properly assess the IP sensitivity of releasing an obfuscated model for bug analysis.

Hello everyone,

To present the obfuscation feature, I sent the following presentation to Brandon. If it is ok, I will create a gerrit review to add it to the Capella documentation.

***************************
The "Obfuscate Model" feature is provided by Capella.
The algorithm is divided in two parts.

First, there is a scan of the model in org.polarsys.capella.core.model.obfuscator.actions.ObfuscateSemanticResourceCommand and org.polarsys.capella.core.model.obfuscator.actions.ObfuscateRepresentationCommand: it scans the entierty of the content of the different resources of the session. For each textual attribute (name, descriptions, notes ...) that are not IDs, it replaces the value by a random String.

The obfuscation of each attribute is done in org.polarsys.capella.core.model.obfuscator.ObfuscatorHelper.generateUnreadableString. It generates an id using java.util.UUID.randomUUID(). Then it replaces the attribute value by a subset of the id, so each String will have the same length and the file size will be similar.

This is not an encryption of the information but really an obfuscation. The only information that will be kept are:   
    The structure of the modèle (tree structure, ids and link between elements)
    The length of the textual attributes values.
   
The code corresponding to the 1.4.1 version is visible here:
    https://github.com/eclipse/capella/blob/v1.4.x/core/plugins/org.polarsys.capella.core.model.obfuscator/src/org/polarsys/capella/core/model/obfuscator/ObfuscatorHelper.java
    https://github.com/eclipse/capella/tree/v1.4.x/core/plugins/org.polarsys.capella.core.model.obfuscator/src/org/polarsys/capella/core/model/obfuscator/actions

short_desc._text: Richtext can save previous description into the current element

thetext._text:
- Open two diagrams with description. 
- In property view for both element, switch to Description Tab
- If you switch quickly from one diagram to the other, then the description of the first one will be displayed instead of the second.

Prerequisites:
Diagram A, having as description “AAAA”
Diagram B, having as description “BBBB”.


Scenario:
1) Open the two diagrams, and in the properties view select the description tab.
2)Select diagram B, switch fast to diagram A and come back fast to diagram B.

-> Diagram B has the description of diagram A.

Analysys:
In org.polarsys.kitalpha.richtext.widget.internal.ListenerInstaller.installChangeContentListener(MDENebulaBasedRichTextWidget) we have a listener that listens to the event ‘change’ and save the content of the rich text.

According to the CKEditor documentation (https://ckeditor.com/docs/ckeditor4/latest/api/CKEDITOR_editor.html#event-change):

“The change event is fired when the content of the editor is changed. Due to performance reasons, it is not verified if the content really changed. The editor instead watches several editing actions that usually result in changes. This event may thus in some cases be fired when no changes happen or may even get fired twice.”


The content of the editor changes in 2 cases:
- The user entered a new text on the keyboard, or copy pasted something.
- We programmatically use the ‘setText’ method to replace the content of the editor.

It is the 2nd case that is problematic for our scenario.

Select diagram B, switch fast to diagram A and come back fast to diagram B:

The object is now B, the feature is now that of B, the editor text is that of A for the moment. We now do a setText call with the description of B, the description is now being modified but due to the async nature CKEditor it might not be yet modified in the UI. The handler is now called because a ‘change’ happened, so we perform a save with the description which is that of A.

The fix is to not use the ‘change’ event, but ‘key’ (https://ckeditor.com/docs/ckeditor4/latest/api/CKEDITOR_editor.html#event-key) event, the text will be saved only when the user modifies it, and not when we modify it programmatically.

This does not induce a performance degradation, since the scenarios which lead to the event being fired are smaller.
Fixed

short_desc._text: [Richtext] Asynchronous set / save and load issues

thetext._text:
Richtext editor is using a browser, and so on, there many asynchronous calls which lead to inconsistencies.

- When LoadContent() is called, the browser might not be ready, then the load doesn't occurs.

- When setText is called, setText is finished even if the browser is not yet aware of the new text. (getText returns the old text for a short time period)

- When SaveContent() is called twice in a short time, the second one is raising a 'Permission denied' exception since the first one hasn't complete.

short_desc._text: Potential leak in SiriusSessionFactory

thetext._text:
Created attachment 282928
potentialLeak.png

Steps to reproduce (in debug mode):
* Launch a runtime
* Create a new Capella project
* Add a breakpoint in method "org.eclipse.sirius.business.internal.session.danalysis.DAnalysisSessionImpl.close(IProgressMonitor)"; just after the code that sets the "transactionalEditingDomain" to null.
* Close the session with contextual menu "Close" on the aird file
* The execution is stopped on the breakpoint.
* You can observed ,in the Variables view, like in potentialLeak.png, that transactionalEditingDomain is really set to null, but "val$transactionalEditingDomain" has always the reference to the SemanticEditingDomainFactory$SemanticEditingDomain.

This is because in the code, the final parameter transactionalEditingDomain is directly used in the anonymous inner class. In team environment a leak has been detected with this problem and fixed in MelodyTeamSessionFactory. It is better to directly use this.getTransactionalEditingDomain() instead of the parameter. I not reproduce the leak only in Capella but the code will be cleaner.
Proposition of "fix": https://github.com/eclipse/capella/pull/220

short_desc._text: CapellaSessionHelper resourceSet options are not consistent with all Capella resource implementation.

thetext._text:
Created attachment 282548
RecordUnknownFeature option in Capella repository

CapellaSessionHelper.checkModelsFullCompliancy(URI) sets the option XMLResource.OPTION_RECORD_UNKNOWN_FEATURE to false for all its resourceSet

This is not consistent with the choices done in all Capella resource implementation (see attached screenshot) nor with Sirius resources.

I currently get errors in the add-on (Team for Capella) while CapellaSessionHelper to check the compliancy (version, .afm, viewpoints, ...) before doing add-on related behavior on the project.

If I simply open the IFE project (v1.4.x, current commit 2fc280e7291e148d13c7b5b97c362668bf039672), no error are reported even if it contains at least one unknown feature


The use of CapellaSessionHelper.checkModelsFullCompliancy(URI) triggers :

> org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.FeatureNotFoundException: Feature 'condition' not found.
>  (platform:/resource/In-Flight%20Entertainment%20System/
> In-Flight%20Entertainment%20System.melodymodeller, 820, 63)

The helper triggers the load of the .aird Sirius session, and its automatic migration loads the capella model (migration provided by Bug 561385)


It seems that: 
* IFE sample might need to be cleaned
* Opening models from 1.4.0 in Capella 1.4.1 might require to launch the migration 
* CapellaSessionHelper resourceSet options might need to be reviewed.

The impacted element in the Capella model: 

        <ownedStateEvents xsi:type="org.polarsys.capella.core.data.capellacommon:ChangeEvent"
            id="ebc7485e-718b-4753-93bf-4ee63c5ce81b" name="ChangeEvent 1" expression="#f32488b8-bcc5-4e97-acb7-4e0537b0217f"
            condition="#f32488b8-bcc5-4e97-acb7-4e0537b0217f">
          <ownedConstraints xsi:type="org.polarsys.capella.core.data.capellacore:Constraint"
              id="f32488b8-bcc5-4e97-acb7-4e0537b0217f" name="cruising altitude reached"/>

thetext._text:
1) Logical Components that are not Actors (isActor: false) are transitioned as BEHAVIOR Physical Components (isActor: false)

2) Logical Components that are Actors (isActor: true) and are part of a component hierarchy where at least one Logical Component that is not an actor (isActor: false) exists, are transitioned as BEHAVIOR Physical Components (isActor: true)

3) Logical Components that are Actors (isActor: true) and do not obey rule 2 are transitioned as NODE Physical Components (isActor: true)

short_desc._text: Avoid inter-resource set dependencies with platform plug-in elements

thetext._text: If there are elements which are outside comparison scopes but referenced within the scopes through unidirectional cross-references (typically, from platform plug-ins), then a merge can result in those elements being similarly referenced in the opposite scope. In the case where the comparison is computed between two models that are open, the opposite scope is in another resource set. But that resource set may already have the same out-of-scope elements loaded through the same platform plug-in URI. If there is functional logic that is based on equality by object reference, then it may fail on the merged model because it finds elements loaded in the opposite resource set: even though the elements are the same, the Java objects that represent them are not.
An obvious solution consists in resolving platform plug-in elements locally, either in general or in certain cases where it is needed. Beware of the possible performance cost.

short_desc._text: Memory leak with org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui.listener.FileModificationPreCommitListener

thetext._text:
I detected this memory leak during a more global analysis about memory leaks in TeamForCapella.
In Capella environment, the FileModificationPreCommitListener is added to the SessionsListener with org.eclipse.sirius.business.api.session.SessionManager.addSessionsListener (SessionManagerListener). It is never removed. It's a memory leak. Furthermore, the FileModificationPreCommitListener retains the TransactionalEditingDomain with the target field (and with a TED potentially a lot of other Objects are retained).

Steps to reproduce:
* Launch Capella "with Yourkit"
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (first capture)
* In "Object explorer" view of YourKit, filter on {{org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui.listener.FileModificationPreCommitListener}}.
* There is 0 instance of FileModificationPreCommitListener.
* Create a new Capella project Capella1
* Launch a garbage collector
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (second capture)
* In "Object explorer" view of YourKit, filter on {{org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui.listener.FileModificationPreCommitListener}}.
* There are 3 instances of FileModificationPreCommitListener.
* Create a new Capella project Capella2
* Launch a garbage collector
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (third capture)
* In "Object explorer" view of YourKit, filter on {{org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui.listener.FileModificationPreCommitListener}}.
* There are 5 instances of FileModificationPreCommitListener.
* Create a new Capella project Capella2
* Launch a garbage collector
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (fourth capture)
* In "Object explorer" view of YourKit, filter on {{org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui.listener.FileModificationPreCommitListener}}.
* There are 7 instances of FileModificationPreCommitListener.
* Close project Capella1 (the contextual menu on aird is not used to avoid other potential memory leaks)
* Close project Capella2 (the contextual menu on aird is not used to avoid other potential memory leaks)
* Close project Capella3 (the contextual menu on aird is not used to avoid other potential memory leaks)
* Launch a garbage collector
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (fifth capture)
* In "Object explorer" view of YourKit, filter on {{org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui.listener.FileModificationPreCommitListener}}.
* There are always 7 instances of FileModificationPreCommitListener. They are retained by the programmaticListeners field of org.eclipse.sirius.business.internal.session.SessionManagerImpl.

Fix proposition: https://github.com/eclipse/capella/pull/204

With the above pull request the result is:
* First capture: 0 instance
* Second capture: 2 instances
* Third capture: 3 instances
* Fourth capture: 4 instances
* Fifth capture: 1 instance

The remaining instance is created during the first project creation in org.polarsys.capella.common.libraries.manager.LibraryManager.getProviders(). The CapellaWorkspaceProvider is created until creation of a new FileModificationPreCommitListener. This "problem" will be handle in another issue. Indeed the field workspaceDomain is a TransactionalEditingDomain that it is never disposed. I do not know at this point whether it is normal or not.

Corresponding stack of the creation of remaining FileModificationPreCommitListener:
Thread [main] (Suspended (breakpoint at line 107 in FileModificationPreCommitListener))	
	owns: SemanticEditingDomainFactory  (id=2319)	
	FileModificationPreCommitListener.<init>() line: 107	
	NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Constructor<?>, Object[]) line: not available [native method]	
	NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Object[]) line: not available	
	DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Object[]) line: not available	
	Constructor<T>.newInstance(Object...) line: not available	
	EquinoxRegistryStrategy(RegistryStrategyOSGI).createExecutableExtension(RegistryContributor, String, String) line: 204	
	ExtensionRegistry.createExecutableExtension(RegistryContributor, String, String) line: 934	
	ConfigurationElement.createExecutableExtension(String) line: 246	
	ConfigurationElementHandle.createExecutableExtension(String) line: 63	
	ExtensionPointHelper.createInstance(IConfigurationElement, String) line: 224	
	SemanticEditingDomainFactory$SemanticEditingDomain.getEditingDomainListeners() line: 378	
	SemanticEditingDomainFactory$SemanticEditingDomain.<init>(SemanticEditingDomainFactory, AdapterFactory, TransactionalCommandStack, ResourceSet) line: 330	
	SemanticEditingDomainFactory$SemanticEditingDomain.<init>(SemanticEditingDomainFactory, AdapterFactory, TransactionalCommandStack) line: 313	
	SemanticEditingDomainFactory.doCreateEditingDomain(TransactionalCommandStack) line: 678

short_desc._text: Memory leak org.polarsys.kitalpha.ad.services.manager.ViewpointManager

thetext._text:
Created attachment 282794
Screenshot of the size of instances Map from ViewpointManager in Yourkit

I detected this memory leak during a more global analysis about memory leaks in TeamForCapella.
In Capella environment, the static variable instances of ViewpointManager causes a memory leak on all ResourceSet of opened sessions.

Steps to reproduce:
* Launch Capella "with Yourkit"
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (first capture)
* In "Object explorer" view of YourKit, filter on "org.polarsys.kitalpha.ad.services.manager.ViewpointManager".
* Expand the class node (with a "C" as icon and not a "O")
* Expand the instances variable
* The size of this map is 0.
* Disable "Link with Editor" in the Project Explorer view (to avoid other potential memory leaks)
* Create a new Capella project Capella1
* Create a new Capella project Capella2
* Create a new Capella project Capella3
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (second capture)
* In "Object explorer" view of YourKit, filter on "org.polarsys.kitalpha.ad.services.manager.ViewpointManager".
* Expand the class node (with a "C" as icon and not a "O")
* Expand the instances variable
* The size of this map is 3, one by ResourceSet of each Session.
* Close project Capella1 (the contextual menu on aird is not used to avoid other potential memory leaks)
* Close project Capella2 (the contextual menu on aird is not used to avoid other potential memory leaks)
* Close project Capella3 (the contextual menu on aird is not used to avoid other potential memory leaks)
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (third capture)
* In "Object explorer" view of YourKit, filter on "org.polarsys.kitalpha.ad.services.manager.ViewpointManager".
* Expand the class node (with a "C" as icon and not a "O")
* Expand the instances variable
* The size of this map is always 3. So the 3 ResourceSet are memory leaks. When ResourceSet is retained, a lot of other Objects can be retained.

The final size must be 0 as during the org.polarsys.kitalpha.ad.services.manager.ViewpointManager.getInstance(ResourceSet), an AdapterImpl has been added to remove the ViewpointManager when the last resource is removed from the resource set.
But the code org.polarsys.kitalpha.ad.integration.sirius.listeners.RegisterMetadataListener.notify(Session, int) recreates a new ViewpointManager when a SessionListener.CLOSED notification is received. I think the notification SessionListener.CLOSING must be listen instead of SessionListener.CLOSED.
I've created the pull request https://github.com/eclipse/kitalpha/pull/22 to fix the problem.
Patch accepted and merged in master and 1.4.x

* 1.4.x: commit https://github.com/eclipse/kitalpha/commit/2248413bc07e996044e7a1396abb3032ae272746
* master: commit https://github.com/eclipse/kitalpha/commit/93df138bf9857bd1951488bb8b1c6359223715da

short_desc._text: Memory leak in CapellaSessionHelper.checkModelsFullCompliancy(URI)

thetext._text:
This leak has been detected during an analysis about memory leaks in Team for Capella context. Indeed, this method is only used in this context.

When it is called, the temporary resourceSet is not correctly cleaned:
1- Resource are unloaded but not with the org.eclipse.sirius.business.api.resource.strategy.ResourceStrategyRegistry (used everywhere else)
2- The resources are not removed from the resourceSet and this creates a memory leak in Kitalpha, org.polarsys.kitalpha.ad.services.manager.ViewpointManager. The instance of ViewpointManager created for this resourceSet is not removed because the adapter added in ViewpointManager.getInstance(ResourceSet) is not called.

There is no real steps to validate in Capella context. The steps to validate in Team for Capella context is:
* Launch a T4C server (with a blank database)
* Launch a T4C client on a clean workspace (with YoutKit)
* Import the project IFE in workspace
* Ensure that "Link with Editor" is disabled in "Project Explorer" view
* Launch a garbage collector
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (first capture)
* In "Object explorer" view of YourKit, filter on "org.eclipse.emf.internal.cdo.transaction.CDOTransactionImpl".
* There is 0 instance of "CDOTransactionImpl".
* In "Object explorer" view of YourKit, filter on "org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceSetImpl".
* There is 0 instance of "ResourceSetImpl".
* Export the project IFE to the server
** With contextual menu "Export.../Team for Capella/Export model to remote repository" on the project
** On first page, click on "Test connection" (use credentials user1/user1)
** On second page, uncheck the 3 options "Override existing resources", "Connect to the exported project" and "Export referenced workspace images"
** On second page, click on "Finish"
** A popup appears to say that "The model has been successfully exported to the repository". Click on OK.
* Launch a garbage collector
* Capture a memory snapshot with yourkit (second capture)
* In "Object explorer" view of YourKit, filter on "org.eclipse.emf.internal.cdo.transaction.CDOTransactionImpl".
* Expected: There is 0 instance of "CDOTransactionImpl". Indeed, the local session is not opened and the wizard should not retain any CDOTransaction. --> OK
* In "Object explorer" view of YourKit, filter on "org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceSetImpl".
* Expected: There is 0 instance of "ResourceSetImpl". --> KO, there is one retained by "ViewpointManager.instances"

(In reply to Laurent Redor from comment #0)
> * Expected: There is 0 instance of "ResourceSetImpl". --> KO, there is one
> retained by "ViewpointManager.instances"

The last step of "steps to validate" is wrong. It must be replaced by:
* Expected: There are 2 instances of "ResourceSetImpl":
** One retained by the "org.eclipse.sirius.business.internal.componentization.ViewpointRegistryImpl" (where all the known VSM resources are loaded).
** One retained for Eclipse E4 : "org.eclipse.e4.ui.internal.workbench.E4XMIResource", "org.eclipse.e4.ui.internal.workbench.ResourceHandler", ...

--> KO, there is another one retained by "ViewpointManager.instances"

short_desc._text: Kitalpha downloads area: 54G

thetext._text:
Your project's download area is suboptimal: older releases, nightly builds, large backup files, etc.

- Nightly, weekly, milestone and RC builds should be deleted

- Older releases must be moved to archive.eclipse.org. If moved into the same directory structure, links typically do not need to be updated, as our 404 Not Found handlers will look for the file in the archives before throwing the error.


https://download.eclipse.org/oomph/archive/eclipse/kitalpha/index.html

1. Please move older releases to archive.eclipse.org
2. tmp and test folders should be deleted
3. PR/Nightly and milestone builds should be deleted.
Clean up has been done.

short_desc._text: Memory leak in RichTextEditor

thetext._text:
Created attachment 283687
Yourkit analysis

Steps to reproduce:
* Launch Capella
* Create a new Project
* Close Capella
* Launch Capella with Yourkit
* Open the session (double click on the aird file)
* Expand the semantic model and select "Operational Analysis"
* In the Properties view, activate the first "Description" tab
* Expected: The "rich text" editor is visible.
* Select the project
* Click on the Eclipse menu bar "Project/Close" (this is used to close the session without using contextual menu that causes other memory leaks).
* In Yourkit:
    * Capture a memory snapshot and open it
    * in the "Object explorer" section, filter with "org.polarsys.capella.core.data.oa.impl.OperationalAnalysisImpl"
    * Observed (not expected): You have one OperationalAnalysisImpl object retained by the RichTextEditor (see "yourkit.png").
This is maybe caused by the keyListener added in org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.properties.richtext.CapellaMDERichTextFactory.installKeyListener(MDERichTextWidget) but never removed.

This item is being proposed due to a number of forum entries that I've seen where people new to Capella are trying to use requirements in their diagrams and are not knowledgeable of the Requirements viewpoint. short_desc._text: Contextual menu did not show 'Move diagrams' after opening a diagram

thetext._text:
Created attachment 283845
use case to reproduce

After opening the diagram, the contextual menu did not show 'Move diagrams' menu.
To display it in the contextual menu, we need to close diagram and/or click somewhere else.

Step to reproduce:
* import the attached Capella project in your workspace 
* open session
* open diagram called "diagram1"
* open contextual menu --> 'move diagram' does not appear. (BUG)

When the user open the diagram, the moveRepresentation menu is disposed (RepresentationActionProvider class) in order to make sure action contained list are freed at each selection time.
(For example, if you display menu "Move diagrams" on a first diagram, some sub menu will appears to choose where to move. 
Thanks to this method, these submenus won't be displayed if you display menu "Move diagrams" on a second diagram. Only those concerning the second diagram will be displayed.)

The dispose of the moveRepresentation menu explains why the menu disappear after opening. 
So to display it then, we have to launch a selection change event in order to re-initialize menu, for example by clicking on an other item or on the diagram again.

This dispose security (to freed the list) is already present in class MoveRepresentationMenuManager.
Indeed, when sub menus of "Move diagrams" menu are initialized for a given selection, existing menu items are removed.
So in fact, the dispose of moveRepresentation in class RepresentationActionProvider is overkill and it can be removed.
With this fix, after opening diagram, menu ```Move diagrams``` is displayed correctly and menu "Move diagrams" is not complete with previous sub menus.


Fix is proposed here : https://github.com/eclipse/capella/pull/323

short_desc._text: Allocated Functions in Exchange Scenario diagrams

thetext._text:
In Exchange Scenario (ES) diagrams, the tool 'Allocated Function' used on a lifeline allows selecting a Function to indicate that at this point of the lifeline, the selected Function is executed.

The Function is represented as a box on the lifeline (semantic element 'StateFragment') and can be moved along the lifeline to indicate whether the Function execution is earlier or later than some other Function execution or incoming/outgoing Functional Exchanges.

If we delete the ES diagram and re-create it, the following problematic behaviors happen:
* We can no longer move the box along the lifeline
* We cannot delete the 'StateFragment' element: the Capella dialog for deletion appears but upon OKaying it nothing is performed
* The tool 'Allocated Function' no longer works: the dialog for selecting a Function appears, but upon OKaying it nothing is performed.

Closing/opening the session seems to fix these issues.

short_desc._text: Description can be lost when switching quickly between elements with an opened description editor in property view

thetext._text:
Due to the asynchronization of Nebula Richtext editor events, when we switch quickly between elements with an opened description editor in property view, the description of an element can be unexpectedly replaced by the description of another element. 
The solution for the bug 561365 was to dispatch all the events of Nebula Richtext editor for each action. However, this has some side-effects, for example double-click events appear without any reason.
We need to find a way to react to asynchronized events of Nebula Richtext editor instead of forcing them to be synchronized with our UI events.

short_desc._text: Problems with the layout of the Capella search page

thetext._text:
There are some problems with the layout of Capella search page:
1. The filtered tree does not grab the extra space when possible. When we resize the Search dialog or expand it, the filtered tree does not change its size.
2. The filter checkboxs are not well layouted. Sometimes it's overlapped by other fields.

short_desc._text: Deletion of Title Block prevent deletion of other elements

thetext._text:
When a Title Block is deleted in addition to other diagram elements, only the title block is deleted.
This is due to some UnexecutableCommand.INSTANCE created while deletion.
The TitleBlockItemProvider is customised to display the block as a tree but getParent is also used in deletion which can lead to invalid created commands.

short_desc._text: Some operations might create unwanted Operational Analysis Entities as a silent side effect

thetext._text:
The problem resides in the use of the org.polarsys.capella.core.model.helpers.BlockArchitectureExt.getFirstComponent(BlockArchitecture, boolean: TRUE) method in functions called at the Operational Level.

Since there is no Operational System concept at that level, this method constantly creates a new Entity at each call.

Main use case: 
When entity are decomposed, contextual elements of Operational Entity Blank

- On a Operational Entity Blank,
- create an entity OE1 and a sub entity OE11
- on property view of diagram, add OE11 as Contextual Elements
- refresh, => StackOverFlowError, and a lot of Entity are created on the model.

short_desc._text: Potential "Invalid thread access" in SemanticBrowserView.setInput

thetext._text:
This can happen in a collaborative context, with Team For Capella, when the connection with the server is lost. In this case, the cleaning of the SemanticBrowserView is called out of the main thread (UI thread) and causes an "Invalid thread access".

The corresponding stacktrace is:
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:4723)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:4638)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:4609)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:432)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkWidget(Widget.java:352)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.setRedraw(Control.java:3663)

	at org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.semantic.browser.view.SemanticBrowserView.refresh(SemanticBrowserView.java:1099)
	at org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.semantic.browser.view.SemanticBrowserView.refresh(SemanticBrowserView.java:1125)
	at org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.semantic.browser.view.SemanticBrowserView.setInput(SemanticBrowserView.java:1076)
	at org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.semantic.browser.view.SemanticBrowserView.clean(SemanticBrowserView.java:400)
	at org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.semantic.browser.view.SemanticBrowserView$CloseSessionListener.notify(SemanticBrowserView.java:135)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.business.internal.session.SessionManagerImpl.notifyUpdatedSession(SessionManagerImpl.java:159)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.business.internal.session.SessionManagerImpl.access$1(SessionManagerImpl.java:157)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.business.internal.session.SessionManagerImpl$1.notify(SessionManagerImpl.java:134)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.business.internal.session.danalysis.DAnalysisSessionImpl.notifyListeners(DAnalysisSessionImpl.java:1228)
	at org.eclipse.sirius.business.internal.session.danalysis.DAnalysisSessionImpl.close(DAnalysisSessionImpl.java:1467)
	at fr.obeo.dsl.viewpoint.collab.internal.remotesession.CollaborativeDAnalysisSessionImpl.close(CollaborativeDAnalysisSessionImpl.java:324)
	at fr.obeo.dsl.viewpoint.collab.ui.internal.session.CloseUISessionsByJob.run(CloseUISessionsByJob.java:127)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:63)

Steps to reproduce:
* Launch a server
* Launch a client
* Open a "shared" session (the activity explorer is opened)
* Open one diagram
* Open the "Semantic Browser" view
* Select one element in the diagram
* Close the server
* The above exception is thrown.
Proposition of fix: https://github.com/eclipse/capella/pull/339

short_desc._text: Do not consider closed session as dirty

thetext._text:
This problem has been observed sometimes in a collaborative context, with Team For Capella, when then connection with the server is lost.

Indeed, the code in "org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.navigator.viewer.CapellaSaveable.isDirty()" checks that the current session is known of the SessionManager but not that it is opened. This can happen randomly because of execution of several threads in parallel.
Proposition of fix: https://github.com/eclipse/capella/pull/340

short_desc._text: Handle specific "connection lost" problem that can appear when using Capella with collaborative environment (Team for Capella)

thetext._text:
As for Sirius bug 566274, in a collaborative environment, when the data is host on a server, the connection with the server can be lost. Capella is not ready to handle this context. If Capella tries to access to data, for example with an async refresh of the UI that needs information from data to be refreshed, a org.eclipse.net4j.util.lifecycle.LifecycleException is thrown with the message "Not active: CDOTransactionImpl". This kind of errors is showed to the end-user instead of silently catch it. Indeed, in this situation, the UI should be refreshed with "blank data" instead of displaying an "incomprehensible" popup to the end-user.

In bug 566274, a specific query has been added to "detect" this specific case. The goal of this issue is to use this specific query to avoid this kind of problem.
Proposition of fix: https://github.com/eclipse/capella/pull/341

Hello,

When I try to use the tool "Allocated functions", I am now able to display the function.

Compare to previous version it is a more complicate way to create model.
Error is due to a wrong version of a droppin.

short_desc._text: Create a new table to specify Situation Expressions

thetext._text:
Rows are Statemachines.
Columns are Situations.

A cell textual editor allows to type boolean expressions that refer to states of the given row's statemachine. The expression of a situation is then the implicit AND of all the row expressions, as stated by requirement. If a Situation's Expression does not conform to these constraints, the Situation is filtered from the table.

Karl
